reviews.text: The Marriott Courtyard would get more of my business if they would upgrade their towels. They are too thin and they are rough. They also did not have complimentary coffee in their lobby. This location was selling the Starbucks brand in their cafe. It is unacceptable for this chain.
reviews.title: Marriott needs to upgrade their towels!

reviews.text: Great location in the French Quarter, clean, well appointed rooms. Friendly staff. On the downside, the lobby on second floor is cumbersome to get to, then you have to walk across the lobby and take a second elevator to get to your room. Tiny workout room. The location trumps the inconveniences.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: this is the third time i've stayed at this hotel and i'll stay there again! perfectly located in the french quarter and garden district, everything i want to do is within walking distance.
reviews.title: FIVE STARS

reviews.text: the staff is very friendly and accomodating; the rooms sparkle and the cost, very reasonable.
reviews.title: Not your typical Courtyard

reviews.text: thanks for making all my trips great. and it doesn't hurt that the Ritz Carlton is connected to it!!
reviews.title: Great location, impecable rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fine hotel located in the French Quarter adjacent to the Ritz-Carlton. The suites are nicely sized consisting of a comfortable sitting room and large bedroom. Unfortunately, the suite we were given only had a window over the interior air shaft, so there was a distinct lack of natural light in the room. As we were not in the room much during the day, this fortunately did not pose much of an issue. We were impressed by the quiet and lack of exterior noise that filtered into the room.
reviews.title: Very Decent Value for the Right Price

reviews.text: The hotel was clean and nicely maintained, and unlike many higher end hotels, offered free wifi. Personnel at the desk were friendly and helpful. While there was an exercise room, there was no pool. In order to use the spa at the Ritz-Carlton, considerable additional charges applied.
reviews.title: Courtyard New Orleans/Iberville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I made reservations here in July 2012 for May 2013 when the hotel was still the Iberville Suites (pre-Ramada Courtyard purchase). The rate I was given, and which was honored by the current ownership, was at least $200 a night less than what they currently charge, now approximately $400 a night. Considering the wide range of hotel options in New Orleans, I am not certain that I would stay there again if it meant paying their current rates.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Great Location

reviews.text: We had the two bedroom Queen which was very clean, affordable, and had a nice view of the parking lot across the street. I liked the room setup and the rolling, industrial barn style door between rooms was nice. I was not as fond of the rolling, industrial barn style door on the washroom. I do like my privacy and it did not lock. Not cool if you're staying with kids who like to open the door when you're sitting on the stool or stepping out of the shower. However, I was fortunate to be child free this trip, and my girlfriends were absolutely respectful of my privacy, so it was fine - this time. I wouldn't come back with the kids though. I liked the sink and fridge in the outer room because it made pre-dinner cocktails easy peasy. Two separate rooms made it nice to keep the tv noise down when one of us was ready for bed. I was a little confused the first few times I tried to find my room. The hallways are labrynth-like. The location is pretty great though. Very close to Louis Armstrong Park and also Canal and Bourbon Streets for shopping, dining, drinking, and/or partying.
reviews.title: Great location, great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in New Orleans today for five days. We love the layout of the room and the location of the hotel. It is connected to The Ritz-Carlton, New Orleans and room service is from the Ritz-Carlton. This is not your typical Courtyard. This is one of the best hotels we have stayed at besides The Ritz-Carlton. It is a block from Bourbon St and many restaurants are nearby. The daily parking is high but we did not park our car at the hotel. We parked our car about 1 block away at a parking garage that was $20 every 24 hours.
reviews.title: This is the old Iberville Suites - but newly remodeled ... very nice!

reviews.text: One block off Canal and Bourbon, can't beat that
reviews.title: Convenient location and huge rooms

reviews.text: Rooms are huge, with a separate sitting area, kitchenette and bedroom. Adequate size bathroom. Iron and board for those wrinkled shirts. I had one of the inner rooms and it was very quiet even with all the hustle and bustle outside.
reviews.title: in the heart of it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was American motel style, which means that the coffee was the only thing served warm. A few things to choose between but not much. Overall quite nice, with the prospect of a night at jazz pubs even an expensive hotel is a bargain.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

reviews.text: My family stayed at this hotel which is very close to everything, We didn't hear a lot of noise despite this. The rooms were large and attractive. I was a bit naive about how racy Bourbon St can be. I would have picked a different area since i have children. We stayed off that street but would have to cross it to get to where we were going. A little weird seeing topless women in the daytime. If you are adults only, it would be a fun hotel. The don't have literature about nearby sites. When we asked for help finding a swamp tour the company they recommended was full and they offered no other options. Going on line I found several and had a great time, but would have liked more help from the staff.
reviews.title: Location, location, location!

reviews.text: We just returned home after spending 5 nights at the Marriott Courtyard on Iberville. The hotel is actually connected to and directly behind the Ritz Carlton, and the entrance on Iberville is almost hidden, as it's tucked away where the valet is located. It's less than 2 blocks from Bourbon Street, so you're very close to everything, but far enough away that it's quiet. One block (around the corner) from Canal, and the trolley. We parked our car at the hotel, and walked everywhere the entire time; it's that great of a location! Once you enter at ground level, there's an elevator that takes you to the second floor lobby, and then another short walk to the elevators that take you to the rooms. The entire hotel has been recently renovated, and it shows. It had more of an upscale boutique hotel feel than a typical Courtyard. The beautiful second floor lobby has a small café, as well as a Starbucks and the usual "Market" found at Marriott properties. Our room (1029) was a King Suite that had a nice size living room with a sofa and desk. There was an area separating the living/bedroom, that had a counter area with a small sink, coffee maker, and small refrigerator. Our bedroom was also large, well appointed, with a very comfortable king bed. The bathroom has a large shower and vanity area. Both the living and bedroom have 42" flat screen tvs, and there are more than adequate outlets in both rooms for charging electronics. Room service is available through the Ritz Carlton, as well as spa services. Since we were here for 5 nights, another unexpected bonus was a guest laundry room right on our floor (not sure if other floors have laundry rooms) with 3 washers and 3 dryers. $1 wash / $1 dry (bring quarters) The only thing missing was a table for folding. I would definitely return. If you're on the fence about where to stay in NOLA, you won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: Expensive but worth it!

reviews.text: We recently returned from a three night stay and because it was so pleasant, I decided to make time to come in and gush about the hotel. The staff was flawless! Upon arrival, we realized the very first room we were given had no view. We asked for a different room with a view and were granted our wish within two minutes of our request. The carpeting is plush and the decor is very modern. Have I mentioned that the staff is remarkable? Everyone who worked there greeted us with a smile and offered to help us in any way we needed. The location is very close to the "staples" of New Orleans (Bourbon, Cafe DuMonde, shops, great food, etc). The only downside was the cost of parking which was $37 dollars per night. We moved the car after the first night because there are parking garages closer to the hotel that cost less. Overall, the experience was great and I will definitely be making reservations with this hotel again in the near future.
reviews.title: Outstanding service!

reviews.text: We stayed here during the French Quarter festival in April 2013. When we arrived, the person in front of us was being told that their 2 bed suite was not available, and their group of 4 large men would have to share a smaller one. They offered them 20.00, and said were sold out so too bad. When I got to the counter she said the same to us, but refused to give me a discount because I had paid in full already! We reserved the room and paid in January, but some how we were not guaranteed, nor a price reduction! The front desk clerk was cold and didn't even apologize.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel. Disappointing Service.

reviews.text: That being said, the room was very nice, and the hotel is in a great location. It has all the charm of bourbon street, but a little further away so you can actually sleep. I would have given the hotel 5 stars, if they had not oversold the hotel.
reviews.title: Not As it appears

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel 4/19-4/23. As the cab pulled up to the hotel I thought 'oh no' but as we walked up everyone was SO nice and accommodating. Upon entering the hotel we were in awe- it was so deceivingly fancy! The girls at the desk were very welcoming and were eager to give us recommendations, maps, corkscrew and toothbrush. The lobby has pods of TVs and small couches and an Internet bar. There is a cafe where you purchase breakfast lunch or snacks as well as drinks, this was the only drawback that there was no breakfast included. We were content with the gym which consisted of 2 treadmills, an elliptical, bike, excercise balls and free weights. The room was immaculate and more than we could've hoped for. The view was not very alluring but then again you go to bourbon st not for the picturesque views. The location is prime for bourbon st adventures and within walking distance to all are attractions including the superdome. We both highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely and well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in the northwest part of the French Quarter (Iberville/Dauphine), but in a quiet area. Easy walk to all parts of the French Quarter, and to the street cars on Canal St and St Charles. Beautiful, modern hotel. Our two rooms each had 2 king size beds! Food available for sale at breakfast and dinner, with snacks available for purchase 24 hrs/day. Beautifully decorated. Probably the most helpful and friendly hotel,staff I've ever encountered in the US. On future trips I will stay here again. The only drawback was that our rooms had views of brick walls, but didn't request a view.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been better!
